page.title: 02FARMING
page.content:
BROWNS FARM, LANDULPH CROSS.
Mr. Brown, tenant farmer, leases his farm from the Duchy of Cornwall. The Browns' have farmed the land for the passed 25 years. Mr. Brown, his son Richard and farm worker Mr. Billing rear a herd of 65 Friesians for milking and a few Herefords for beef. Several of the farm fields are used for turnips and corn as winter feed. The milk yield for the farm can be as high as 9 gallons and as low as 2 gallons a day from each cow. Total milk yield per week averages 1500 gallons. Mrs. Brown keeps 2 dozen chickens and sells the eggs locally. Farm machinery consists of 3 tractors, 2 small ploughs, 1 drill, 1 baler and a shared harvester.
